required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MK-1654 in Infants and Children at Increased Risk for Severe Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) Disease (MK-1654-007)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Randomized, Partially Blinded, Palivizumab- Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics of MK-1654 in Infants and Children at Increased Risk for Severe RSV Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety and tolerability of MK-1654 compared to palivizumab as assessed by the proportion of participants experiencing adverse events (AEs).

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with solicited injection-site Adverse Events (AEs) in RSV Season 1
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with solicited injection-site AEs in RSV Season 1

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with solicited daily body temperature with fever in RSV Season 1
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with solicited daily body temperature with fever in RSV Season 1

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with solicited systemic AEs in RSV Season 1

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with anaphylaxis/hypersensitivity AEs of special interest (AESI) in RSV Season 1
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with anaphylaxis/hypersensitivity AESI in RSV Season 1

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with rash AESI in RSV Season 1
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with rash AESI in RSV Season 1

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with non-serious AEs in RSV Season 1
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with non-serious AEs in RSV Season 1

primary_outcome.measure: participants with serious AEs (SAEs) through the duration of participation in RSV Season 1
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with serious AEs (SAEs) through the duration of participation in RSV Season 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with RSV-associated medically attended lower respiratory infection (MALRI) in RSV Season 1
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with RSV-associated medically attended lower respiratory infection (MALRI) in RSV Season 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants with RSV-associated hospitalization in RSV Season 1
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with RSV-associated hospitalization in RSV Season 1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From approximately 393 days up to 400 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From approximately 393 days up to 550 days

arm_group.description: Participants will receive an intramuscular (IM) injection.
Participants will receive an IM injection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants at increased risk for severe RSV infection recommended to receive palivizumab in accordance with national or local guidelines or professional society recommendations.
- Is available to complete the follow-up period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Requires mechanical ventilation at time of enrollment.
- Has a life expectancy <6 months.
- Has known hepatic or renal dysfunction, or chronic seizure disorder.
- Is hospitalized at the time of randomization unless discharge is expected within 7 days after randomization.
- Has severe immunodeficiency or is severely immunocompromised.
- Has known hypersensitivity to any component of MK-1654 or palivizumab.
